org.perfidix.ouput.asciitable

Class NiceTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.perfidix.ouput.asciitable.NiceTable

  • public final class NiceTable
extends Object
    This class represents a table which allows formatting of data as an ascii table. it takes care of automatically adjusting widths of the tables. A word on the orientations: at the current point of development, the orientation works on COLUMNS and NOT on ROWs. so you can set the orientation of a full ROW, but you cannot set the orientation for each field[x][y] in the table.
    Author:
    Alexander Onea, neue Couch, Sebastian Graf, University of Konstanz

    • Method Detail

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String title)
        Adds a header.
        Parameters:
        title - the text to display within the header

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String title,
             char mark,
             AbstractTabularComponent.Alignment orientation)
        Adds a header row to the table. can be used to give a table some title. 
          addHeader("hello",'.',NiceTable.LEFT)
  would produce a row like
  ... hello ..........................
   {rows in here.}
        Parameters:
        title - the string to display as a header
        mark - the mark to use for the rest of the column
        orientation - the orientation of the header column.

      • addRow

        public void addRow(String[] data)
        Adds a string row. checks that the strings added do not contain newlines, because if so, it has to split them in order to make them fit the row.
        Parameters:
        data - the array of data.

      • addLine

        public void addLine(char fill)
        allows the addition of lines. think of it as a horizontal rule in a table.
        Parameters:
        fill - any character with which to draw the line.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        the main method doing the work. draws everyting.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the formatted table.

      • getColumnWidth

        protected int getColumnWidth(int columnIndex)
        Returns the global column width at index columnIndex.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - the index of the column for which to fetch the width.
        Returns:
        the width (in number of chars) for the column index.

      • updateColumnWidth

        protected void updateColumnWidth(int index,
                     int newSize)
        Performs an update on the column lengths.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the column
        newSize - the new size of the column
